alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 8:44AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Downtown Savannah to Vernonburg. As much as 2 inches has already fallen over parts of the area since 730 AM. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding and urban flooding in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Downtown Savannah, Hunter Army Airfield, Midtown Savannah, Windsor Forest, Hutchinson Island, Coffee Bluff, Montgomery, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Thunderbolt, Vernonburg, Savannah Historic District, White Bluff, Sandfly, Isle Of Hope, Whitemarsh Island and Skidaway Island.
info.instruction: Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
